intro: Pentameris airoides subsp. airoides, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a perennial herb native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, yellowish-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are lanceolate and often have a hairy texture, while its stems are erect and branching. The flowers bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators like bees and butterflies.
